text.0:
Our readers have asked us how accurate new lateral flow tests are.

Covid-19 lateral flow tests work in a similar way to home pregnancy tests. They very rarely return false positives but early studies show false negatives are slightly more common.

https://t.co/ENMrLLiStg
text.1:
We’ve been asked by readers if new Covid-19 vaccines will contain enough mercury to cause brain damage.

The mercury-based chemical thiomersal isn’t often used in vaccines, but there's no evidence that it has any harmful effects even if it is.

https://t.co/Ogx48woBa4
text.2:
We are also seeing repeated claims about suicides being up by "200%."

But as we wrote about in June, there's currently no evidence to suggest this is the case.

https://t.co/wHchtktMdr
text.3:
Nadine Dorries claimed new data shows no increase in suicide figures since lockdown.

The figures only cover around 9 million people so do not definitively show what has happened to the overall number of suicides since the beginning of the pandemic.

https://t.co/iuTaowSFOQ
text.4:
We've been asked to check claims that aluminium in vaccines can cause Alzheimer’s disease.

The amount of aluminium used in vaccines is much less than the typical adult ingests in a day. Scientists have not found a link between this and Alzheimer’s.

https://t.co/LbZkxcvicO
